text.text_translated: Wasfia Nazreen first saw a hula hoop when she was a young girl in her home country, Bangladesh, as she watched a child from another country playing with one. Wasfia did not want to just watch, but she stood by sadly, because in her country, people believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now, Wasfia is one of only a few people in the world who have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro. She is also the first person to hula-hoop on each of these mountains. Her reason for doing this was to empower women and girls in a country that discourages them from doing sport.
